body.p:
State of Indiana,
Harrison County } SS.

Be it remembered that at a term of the Circuit Court within and for the County and state aforesaid, began on the 24th day of March, A D 1862, and continued from day to day by adjornment, before the Hon. George A. Becknell, sole Judge of the 2nd Judicial Circuit of said state was found by the Grand Jury for said Term, among other Indictments, the following, to wit:
"State of Indiana
Harrison County } SS.
Harrison Cicruit Court,
March Term, 1862.

The State of Indiana
vs.
Samuel Allen

The Grand Jurors for the county of Harrison and State of Indiana upon their oath charge and present that at said county on the 6th day of January, in the year
1862, Samuel Allen did, in a rude, insolent and angry Manner, unlawfully, feloniously, purposely and Maliciusly touch, strike and beat William Moore, with a club, which said Samuel Allen then and there had and held in his hands, and also said Samuel Allen in manner & form aforesaid unlawfully assaulted the said William Moore, by shooting at him with a shot gun loaded with powder & shot with the intent then and there, by beating him said William Moore with said club, and shooting at him with said shot gun, unlawfully, feloniously, purposely & maliciously to kill & murder the said William Moore, contrary to the form of the statute in such. cases made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the State of Indiana"
(signed) "A. B Carlton
Pros. Atty."

On the back of the foregoing indictment, is endorsed the following, to wit:
"Harrison Circuit Court
March Term 1862
The State of Indiana
vs } A & B with intent to murder
Samuel Allen

Indictment
a true Bill
Franklin McRae
foreman
Witnesses,
William Moore, John McCuen, Robert Sonner, Harmon Stephens, Daniel McCarty.
A. B. Carlton, Pros Atty."

State of Indiana
Harrison County } SS

I, David M Jones, clerk of the Circuit Court, within and for said County and State, hereby certify that the above and foregoing is a true and complete copy of the Indictment against said Samuel Allen, so found by said Grand Jury, at the March term ^1862^ of said Circuit Court, as the same remains on file in My
In testimony whereof, I hereunto my name, and affix the seal of said Court, at My office in Corydon, this 9th day of June, A. D 1862

David M Jones, clerk
Har Cir Court
